title: Ticket #487: Transfer as much output as possible (think: --keep-going)
description:
If one of the files in transfer_output_files does not exist after the job exits, it would be nice to transfer any other files that do exist.

Johnson Koil Raj from condor-users:

when Starter send the file back to spool directory after condor_vacate_job it started transfer some 19 files in between it failed to transfer one file due to permission issue. It put the job into hold and stop transferring.

why can't condor skip that particular file and continue transferring remaining files to the spool. so we won't last all files. Is it a bug.

I attached the Starter Log.

remarks:
2010-Jul-09 16:15:41 by psilord:
It turns out this has become a high priority ticket slated for implementation into the stable series.

The reason is that it turns out when a program core dumps and you are using transfer_output_files, then if not all of the files exist, you don't get anything back, including the core file.

I have a code complete fix and am now testing it.

2010-Jul-09 16:18:00 by psilord:
Note, the manual must be fixed to note that any file not transferred back in this scenario will be made a zero length file when brought back from the execute machine. Currently there is no way to tell what the complete set of files were that were failed to be brought back from the starter.

2010-Jul-09 16:41:43 by psilord:
zmiller code reviewed the change, I tested it, I committed it and merged it to master.

I'm leaving this ticket open so I document it in the stable 7.4.x version history monday.

2010-Aug-18 14:39:34 by psilord:
Sent doc message to Karen.
derived_tickets: #1504   Filetransfer: don't create 0 length dest files when src file noexist
check_ins:
2010-Jul-14 16:14   Check-in [25561]: Documentation for #487. (By Peter Keller )
2010-Jul-14 15:07   Check-in [18568]: If a bunch of file transfers failed strictly due to PUT_FILE_OPEN_FAILED, then we keep track of the information relating to the first failed one, and continue to attempt to transfer the rest in the list. At the end of the transfer, the job will go on hold with the information of the first failed transfer. [...] (By Peter Keller )
2010-Jul-09 16:38   Check-in [18564]: If a bunch of file transfers failed strictly due to PUT_FILE_OPEN_FAILED, then we keep track of the information relating to the first failed one, and continue to attempt to transfer the rest in the list. At the end of the transfer, the job will go on hold with the information of the first failed transfer. [...] (By Peter Keller )
